intro: Pentatherum hissaricum, commonly known as the Hissarica pentathrum, is a flowering plant native to Central Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its compound leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, thriving in well-drained soils. Its botanical features include a slender stem, pinnately divided leaves, and yellowish-green flowers that bloom in late spring. It is often found in rocky or sandy habitats across regions such as Turkey, Iran, and Afghanistan.
